Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Scharnhorst, can't you hear that? Your crew needs you!
Aren't you tired of trying to tease me? You should be getting ready for battle.
I figured you'd want to know about the danger your beloved crew is in. You need to rush to their aid!
You can give it a rest, Kapitän. Yeah, I care about the crew. I'm not completely selfish! Big deal.

Fields.MenuText: It's no fun if you don't take the bait.
Well, that's all I wanted to hear.
I never thought you were selfish.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not for you.
I'm glad you got what you wanted. Now let's get back to focusing on the Morganas.
Good, because I'm obviously a selfless angel of—Bwahahaha, okay, I couldn't keep a straight face through that.
So you're not going to threaten to leave us to fight the Morganas on our own?
Nah, I like you too much to let you all throw your lives away like that.
Now, come on. All your teasing is going to keep us from the battle. Let's go!
Did she just say she likes me, or was she talking about the whole crew?
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, I was informed of something I found enthralling.
Oh, did you hear about the changes I made to the mess hall menu? I thought marzipan was a more enticing dessert option.
You did what? Marzipan?
You're not a fan? They're going to be in the shape of little pigs. They'll be adorable, you'll love it.
While that sounds delicious, I'm talking about the strings that came attached to our radar system.
Oh, right. Yeah, I've been meaning to mention that to you.
It's a little late, but you can start now. I'm all ears.
I'm guessing January Abbot's men told you what they told me. They want us to utilize what they installed. You're not angry, are you?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, I am. You should've looped me in before making a decision like this.
Honestly, I'm more disappointed than anything else.
No. Just tell me next time, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Loop you in? Do you expect me to check in with you before everything I do?
Disappointed? You sound like a mom right now, Kap. Are you going to ground me next?
I can't make any promises, but I can try.
*ALARM*
Duty calls, Kapitän. We can talk more about this later.
We haven't even—
Gone into...details. I'll find her later. She's not getting away from me that easily.
@BATTLE
Yeah. I do.
Not going to happen.
There've been reports of Morganas that don't show up on ordinary equipment?
That's right, Kapitän, and I didn't even have to repeat myself.
You don't have to be patronizing.
You—You're right, I'm sorry. It's a reflex.
Scharnhorst apologizing, to me? Are you sick?
What, I can't apologize? Focus on our new assignment. We're supposed to be using our radar to track and destroy these "invisible" Morganas that no one else can see.
Mhmmm. And you agreed to all of this without my approval?
It didn't sound like all that much to ask for. I just said what I needed to say to get the system on our ship.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a lot of trouble to me.
It could be worse, I guess.
What happens when they eventually adapt to our equipment and become invisible again?

Fields.DialogueText: Fighting an enemy that thinks they're invisible? Sounds more like fun to me.
We could be dealing with these Morganas without the shiny new radar. You're welcome.
Then we'll get a newer radar and the cycle will begin anew. It's how these things work, Kap.
Scharnhorst, I have to ask was it worth it?
What do you mean? Of course it was worth it.
I mean you went through a lot of effort to earn the funds for it, and now we're roped into some new assignment. I want to make sure you have no regrets.
The last thing anyone on this ship needs, especially me, is to be caught unaware. If this radar helps me keep that from happening, then I'm happy.
That's good enough for me. You don't like surprises, do you?
Nope. Just ask the last person to throw me a birthday party.
I'll keep that in mind.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, our new assignment is begging for our attention.
It's about time. Where are we headed, Kapitän?
Japan. There are Morganas striking one of their ports without warning. We're being sent to deal with the issue.
Japan, huh? We've got quite a way to go then. We better get booking.
Getting sent off to the other side of the world at a moment's notice doesn't bother you?
Nah, I've been expecting it. The INPF is a worldwide thing after all. Are you worried about dealing with other nations?

Fields.MenuText: That's not it. I wasn't sure how you felt about the rest of the world.
A little. Tensions are plenty high.
I'm no fan of politics.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh, I'm not particularly fond of the Japanese, the Americans, or the Brits, but I don't have any problems with them. That is to say, they haven't pissed me off yet.
No need to worry, Kapitän. If the tension breaks, you can count on me to find a way to victory for you.
I'll do the talking then. I'm not just a genius on the battlefield. Besides, people love me.
Okay then, no time to waste. Let's resupply and head to the Orient.
*ALARM*
After we deal with that.
It shouldn't take long.
@BATTLE
Kap, you see that on the horizon?
On the horizon you say? Let's see—Huh? Scharnhorst, give me back my binoculars.
I wouldn't take 'em so often if you kept an eye on them.
What am I looking at? Even with my binoculars I can barely make it out. Is it a rock outcropping?
It's a capsized ship. I'm thinking they might've run into Morganas, or maybe even pirates.
Pirates?
Mhmmm... Though they'd likely take the ship as their own... Either way, if we're quick we could salvage what we can before the ship's at the bottom of the ocean.
That's what you're concerned with?
Always. What are you concerned with?

Fields.MenuText: How about rescuing any survivors?
How about keeping an eye out for any nearby Morganas?
Well, I can't say a salvage attempt wouldn't be unwarranted.

Fields.DialogueText: We can do that too. We can save people and valuables. It's called multitasking.
I assumed that was unsaid. I'm not going to dive into a situation like that with my eyes closed.
That's what I like to hear. Why let all those valuables waste into the waves?
All right, let's go in and see what we can do.
And find! I feel like a kid on Christmas morning, and that ship is my tannenbaum filled with presents.
Scharnhorst, you're drooling.
Sorry, that happens when I fantasize sometimes.
@BATTLE
Oh...
Morganas off the port bow!
@BATTLE
Okay, so Morganas attacked, but we still got one hell of a score out of that wreck. Right, Kapitän?
Don't forget the survivors we rescued.
Yeah, but look at all this stuff!
You know, I think you might've missed your calling Scharnhorst. You're more of a pirate than a military officer.
I'll take that as a compliment. Though the two can be pretty similar.

Fields.MenuText: I see the two as polar opposites.
Well, corrupt officers are like pirates.
Too true!

Fields.DialogueText: Polar opposites? The world isn't black and white.
Not just corrupt. Men and women doing their military jobs can look like villains from an outside perspective.
Be careful what you wish for, Kap. I could talk about pirates all day!
Before all this insanity happened with the Morganas, our original assignment was going to be to disrupt Britain's merchant trade.
Our?
Me and my sis. It's not important. What I'm trying to say is that something like that seems more like something a pirate might do, right?
Well, that's different. It's war.
It might be different, but it's also similar. So you might think I'm a bit of a pirate, but sometimes that's what you need in an officer.
I didn't mean it as an insult.
I'd hope not. Otherwise I'd have to send you to walk the plank.
Don't even joke about that.
You wanted to see me?
So you and your sister are close, huh?
Yeah, we're pretty close. Why do you ask?

Fields.MenuText: I'm trying to get to know you a little better.
You could say I'm...gathering intel.

Fields.DialogueText: You're trying to get to know me by asking about my sister? Seems like a roundabout tactic, if you ask me.
You should keep to gathering intel on the enemy. Unless...you see me as an enemy.
Gneisenau, my sister, has always been... I guess everyone has always loved her, but... I'm not sure how to say this. I mean, we couldn't be more different.
Because she's loved by everyone? From where I'm standing, you two have that in common.
No that's—thanks, that's nice, but I mean that for sisters, we're completely different people.
She's always cared about honor, and she loves to be in the thick of battle.
Whereas I'm of the opinion that morals and honor can't get you so much as a loaf of bread. As for combat, I'd much rather be pulling the strings than taking the shots.
I can see the differences, but I bet you two are more alike in some ways than you'd like to admit..
You'd lose that bet. She's my sister, and I love her, but we are polar opposites.
You both love each other.
Pfft, that doesn't count.
Too late, I'd say I won the bet. Now it's time to collect my winnings.
We didn't actually bet anything!
@BATTLE
You can be a little intense sometimes, but you're far from an enemy.
Hmmm, Japan is bigger than I was expecting.
What were you expecting?
I don't know...maps make it look so puny.
We can make time for sightseeing later. We should keep our eyes open for any of these "invisible" Morganas on our way into port.
We've been picking something up for a little bit. It's been following us. I'm pretty sure it thinks we can't see it.
We've had Morganas tailing us, and you didn't tell me? For how long?!
I would've told you, but I wanted to be positive before we blew it out of the water.

Fields.MenuText: Being your captain is never easy.
Just tell me next time, Scharnhorst, or I swear, I'll... I'll...
I have to say, nice thinking, Scharnhorst.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, I know, right?
You'll do what? Turn us around and head home? Face it, Kap, we know who has all the real power on this ship.
Hmmm, a rare compliment. Keep 'em coming, Kapitän.
All right, looks like we've got some more Morgana friends joining the party. They'll probably strike soon. What do you say we beat them to the punch?
Sounds like a plan to me.
@BATTLE
That was all of them, right?
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
We might want to stay in the area for a little while, just to make sure we got them all.
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
Maybe we should start eating all our meals on the toilet to save time.
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
What are you doing over there, Scharnhorst? Are those dice?
Oh Kapitän, how long have you been there?
Not long at all. What are you up to?
Being in Japan reminded me of this game a Japanese Belle told me about. She was infatuated with all kinds of games, and she told me about a few different gambling ones.
I think this one was...Cho-Han... Yeah, that sounds right.
It looks like you're just rolling dice in a cup.
Well, it's hard to gamble with myself. Oh, I know, you wanna play a round or two? It's super simple.

Fields.MenuText: I've seen you gamble, no thanks.
Sounds fun, but no cheating.
How do you play?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on. This is a totally different game, you'll be fine.
Scout's honor.
You roll a pair of dice in the cup, and bet on if the sum comes out even or odd. Simple, right?
Okay, I think I can fit in a game or two.
*ALARM*
No take backs!
We can play after the fight.
I get it, Morganas always come first. Attention hogs.
@BATTLE
I can see you crossing your fingers.
So?
You were never a scout were you?
Heheheh, come on, just play.
Come on, let's play another game. I think I've got a hot streak going.
Scharnhorst, you've got the eagle eyes. Are those Morganas attacking a ship on the horizon?
What? Hmm...I guess. Does it matter? Let's play!

Fields.MenuText: Scharnhorst, snap out of it. We've got Morganas.
Scharnhorst, we can play more later if we beat those Morganas.
I think you have a gambling problem.

Fields.DialogueText: No, they've got Morganas. We've got a game to play.
Hmmm... How about one game now and one game after?
It's only a problem if you suck at it. I'm awesome, so I can't lose.
How about this... I bet you we can't save that ship. It's too far away, so we won't get there in time.
Sounds like long odds... I bet I can save that ship and sink the Morganas without taking a hit.
Raising the stakes? A true gambler.
You taking that bet or not?
I'll take it.
Great, if I win, we're spending as much time as I want playing Cho-Han.
What do I get if I win?
@BATTLE
I owe you more than my thanks. If you had come just a second later, my crew and I would be fish food.
You'd be more like Morgana food.
It was nothing. I'm the Captain of this fleet.
Including the Scharnhorst. That's me. What about you? Your boat got a name? It's got more scars from the Morgana than serviceable hull at this point.
You can call me Sable. Yeah, I noticed that. I was hoping to ask if you would be willing to tow us to port.

Fields.MenuText: I think we can handle that. It's not far away.
We just left port. We weren't planning on returning for some time.
What do you think, Scharnhorst? Do we have the time?

Fields.DialogueText: So now we're escorting weak little merchant ships? Great...
Yeah, if we don't patrol the area, those invisible Morganas could group back up and attack again.
Well, I'm glad you asked for my opinion. I'm gonna trust your judgement here.
We can pay you if that's the issue.
No, that won't be necessary, Captain Sable.
Never turn down money. Have you learned nothing from me?
We don't have a lot in our holds, but I'm sure we can scrounge something up as payment.
Don't worry about it. You have repairs to worry about.
Still, we'd like something. We'll talk later, Sable.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, shouldn't you be keeping your eye out for Morganas, not staring at our new friends?
Those marks on the hull look weird.
What do you mean?
Well, just look at them. They don't look like they were caused by Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: What, you're an expert on Morgana damage now?
Doesn't look all that weird to me. Though if they don't get it fixed soon, they might start taking on water.
Yeah, I think I can see what you mean. Morganas usually leave a bigger mark.

Fields.DialogueText: No, but as much as I'd like to deny it, I have taken my fair share of hits from them, and they didn't look like that.
That's my point. If a Morgana actually did that, it would've gone straight through them. They don't have a Belle to combat them.
Maybe on us. When it comes to normal ships, they don't leave much of anything at all.
You sound like you have a theory. Care to share?
I think those are wounds from more mundane ordinance. They've been in a fight with another ship recently. In fact, I think they're pirates.
Pirates? That guy? He didn't look like a pirate. He didn't smell like a pirate.
He wouldn't. I think he stole that ship, scraped off any identifying marks, and...who knows what he's been doing with it since then.
You really think the ship we're towing behind us is a pirate ship? Where's the black flag and all the rum?
You're living in the past, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Well, pirates or not, we've got bigger worries in these waters.
Worries? I'm excited! They're real pirates, Kapitän! I've got so many questions!
Wait! I hope you're not running to ask them now! We have Morganas to fight!
@BATTLE
I lost again! You're either the luckiest person in the world, or the best cheater I've ever met.
Heh, I'll teach you which one later. I owe you for getting my crew and I back to port.
Uh, Scharnhorst, what's going on here?
Hey, Kapitän. We're just playing some Cho-Han. Wanna lose some money? Sable knows what he's doing.
She's exaggerating. It's beginner's luck.
Scharnhorst, can I speak to you for a minute in private?
Give me a second. You're going to teach me your tricks and I will get my money back.
I'm not going anywhere.
What are you doing?
Oh, calm down, we're betting a Reichsmark a game. I still have plenty of money.
That's not what I'm concerned with. You're making small talk with someone that might be a pirate.
Oh, he's definitely a pirate. He told me.
What?!
She said I'm a pirate. With excellent hearing, by the way.

Fields.MenuText: Are you crazy, Scharnhorst?
That's hilarious, but be serious.
Shouldn't we arrest him?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not crazy. I'm making interesting friends. I don't see the harm in it.
Seriously, he told me the whole story. Though, I'm not sure I believe all of it.
We're not hunting pirates, we're hunting Morganas. Does he look like a Morgana to you?
I want him off my ship. I don't like any of this.
You don't have to say it twice. I hear you loud and clear, Captain.
Do I get a say in this? I like having a pirate friend! It's like having my very own Klaus Störtebeker. Pirates have the best stories.
Oh, thank you, hun. Wait until I tell you about the time I saved a mermaid from a horde of sharks.
*ALARM*
Dammit, Morganas. We'll talk about this later.
I have every faith that you guys can handle this. I should get back to my ship and make sure it doesn't sink without me. Or set off without me, like the last one... Good luck!
I do not like that guy.
He's harmless. Channel all that energy to our real enemies, Kap.
@BATTLE
I'm harmless. Truly.
Every word was true!
I refuse to believe you rode a whale!
I'm telling you.
You'd tell me if I did, right? I'd rather find out sooner than later.
Oh, you're back? Great.
Yes, I was just looking around for Scharnhorst. I was hoping we could have a chat over some dice. She's such an interesting person. I've never met a Belle before.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, she's amazing. On that we can agree.
She's busy, you might have to come back later.
Well, why don't you go meet another one. This one's taken.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I think we could agree on many things. We just need to get to know each other better.
Oh, that's a shame. I should still drop in to say hello at least.
Oh, I don't mean to steal her away from you. I have my own ship after all. Though, I suppose it doesn't help my case that I stole it.
You know I don't like you, right?
That's fairly obvious. For the life of me, I can't understand why.
You're a pirate. You're nothing but trouble. I don't trust you.
Scharnhorst seems to.
Even more reason to keep an eye on you.
Hmmm, I think I'm beginning to understand now. I want you to understand that I'm only trying to keep my crew safe, much like you are.
These are trying times, with literal monsters prowling the waves. If we had any other options, we wouldn't be living this life. But here we are, and the last thing I want to do is be your enemy.
Are you done?
I suppose so. I'll be on my way now. Don't worry, I won't tell Scharnhorst how you feel about her.
How I feel about her?
Heheh, it's fairly obvious. Tata for now.
I seriously don't like that guy.
@BATTLE
Great, more Morganas...
@BATTLE
How are there Morganas on us already? Shouldn't the alarm be going off?
They couldn't have already beaten the radar, could they?
*BOOM*
Dammit, we'll have to check it out after the fight. We can still win this.
This isn't good. There's something seriously wrong with...the whole damn system!

Fields.MenuText: Let me take a look at it. Maybe I can make some sense of it.
You mean it's broken?
Stupid overpriced piece of junk! Should've known it'd break at the drop of a hat.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't take my word for it? I know what I'm talking about here. I watched them install it.
If it was broken, we could repair it. This is worse.
Don't take it out on the machine. It didn't break on its own.
There are...components missing. From the outside it looks fine, but underneath, half the tech is gone.
Gone? Someone sabotaged our radar systems?
That's what I'm thinking. But who would do that?
I know who my first guess would be.
Sable wouldn't do that. I mean, I told him how expensive our new radar was, but he wouldn't steal from me. He's my friend.
All you know about him are the fabricated stories he's told you. He's not your friend, he's a pirate, a thief.
Let's return to port and ask him then. There has to be another explanation.
Obviously we're going back to port. It's the safest place for us without the radar.
Scharnhorst, where's Sable? We need those parts he stole.
He doesn't have them. We must've just missed him. He told me he wanted to take his ship for a test run. To make sure he wasn't getting scammed with his repairs.
He's afraid of getting scammed? That's rich.
If you're done insulting my friend, I'm going to spend my time figuring out what happened to our radar system.
Before you do that, you should know that we've been called to deal with another batch of invisible Morganas. It's going to be a little difficult with our radar in its current state.
Dammit, seriously? What did you tell them?
Nothing yet.

Fields.MenuText: But I have to tell them the truth.
I wanted to talk to you about it before replying.
I don't think the truth would paint us in a positive light.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't even know what the truth is yet. You're jumping to conclusions.
Well, thanks. We should pretend we never got the message.
You're right about that. At best, they'd find us incompetent.
Find Sable so we can offer his head up as an explanation.
I'll find the parts, that much I can promise. Maybe Sable will even help. He must have some crafty pirate ideas.
@BATTLE
You were right, and now he's a dead man.
Your attitude changed quickly. You find him?
He left a note for me at port. It just says, "Sorry, couldn't resist."
We're going to find him and tie each of his limbs to a different ship in the fleet. Then sail off in opposite directions until we hear a pop.
That's fairly extreme.
A simple firing squad is too good for him.

Fields.MenuText: I'm liking this new attitude.
I thought you were interested in pirates. What happened to that?
I'm not sure about a gruesome death like that, but we do need to track him down.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you approve. Remember, this is what happens when someone betrays me.
There's a thing called honor. He clearly has none. And soon, he'll have no head.
He's not getting away from us that easily. The Morganas will have to wait for a bit. I'm hunting pirates.
You break my trust, and I break your skull open, pirate or not.
Then we should hurry before they get too far. We're going to have to keep a wary eye open for trouble.
I'll make sure we don't get surprised by any Morganas. I won't miss a single one with my eyes on the horizon.
@BATTLE
Morganas coming up fast!
@BATTLE
They contacted me again, Scharnhorst.
What did you tell them?
I told them what we agreed on. That we needed more time to wrap up the Morgana situation in Japan. They were surprised, but they believed me.
Good job, Kapitän. Don't worry, we'll have those parts back before you know it. That ramshackle ship of theirs couldn't have gotten too far.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you're right. I can't use that excuse again without them thinking we're too weak to handle this assignment.
He has to be close. If anyone is gonna find him, it's you.
Don't mess up again. Remember, we're only in this situation because of you.

Fields.DialogueText: You won't have to. I've got this all planned out.
There's no way I can miss them. There's nowhere for them to hide.
Are you trying to make me angry?
All right, I'll stop distracting you now. I wouldn't want you to miss a Morgana because I was bothering you.
Don't worry about it. It's—I mean, it's not a bother. I like your company.
Then maybe I'll stay a little longer.
Feel free. Get your binoculars out, an extra pair of eyes couldn't hurt.
Sure, I... When did you even grab them?
Heheheh.
Yes, get angry, but channel that anger into finding those pirates.
I want to hate you right now, but that's a really good idea.
There it is. I told you I'd find that ugly ship of theirs.
I never doubted you, Scharnhorst, but we have to hurry. It looks like Captain Sable picked another fight with some Morganas.
Why hurry then? Let the Morganas do the dirty work.

Fields.MenuText: Think about the electronics.
Think about their lives.
Hmmm...I see your point.

Fields.DialogueText: Dammit, you're right. Water damage could ruin them for good.
Eh, all pirates inevitably end up at the bad end of an executioner's axe.
Right? I say we just sit back and enjoy the show.
*BOOM*
Looks like the Morganas noticed us.
Are you sure? I'm thinking Sable took a shot at us, the cowardly bastard.
Either way, it's time to enter the fray. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Time to teach both the Morganas and the pirates a lesson!
@BATTLE
In the brig, the lot of you.
What's the plan, Cap'n Blacksands?
You heard it. We're going to the brig. We don't have a ship anymore, and if it wasn't for our friends here, we'd be in the maw of that monster. We're all out of plays to make, mate.
Wah...I hear you, sir.
Blacksands, huh?
It's a better fit for a pirate than Sable, don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: I'm guessing it's not your real name.
I prefer something like Captain Steals-Expensive-Equipment.
It is a bit more menacing.

Fields.DialogueText: Pirates never use their real names. They always use titles like that.
Or how about Steals-From-Friends-And-Has-No-Honor!?
Don't tell him that. That's what he wants to hear. Call him Fluffy, or something.
So where are we ending up?
We'll pass you off to the authorities when we get to a port.
We're not exactly close to port. That might take a while, especially with all that broken equipment. Maybe you'll find time to visit lil old me.
Not likely. We need to go fix that equipment.
It was nothing personal darling. How was I supposed to ignore it after you told me how much it was worth.
You told him how much we paid for it?
It just came up in conversation!
It's not her fault, I know how to get information out of people without them realizing it.
Oh shut up, before I decide to end you here and now. The only thing stopping me is imagining you at your execution, but if you keep talking, this ship can be your gallows.
My apologies. Not another word.
That got dark.
He doesn't deserve to call himself a pirate. I despise that guy.
I'm pretty sure that's my line.
The girl knows her pirates.
A bit of a mouthful, don't you think?
I like the sound of that too.
This is going to take a lot of work to repair. We're not even sure we recovered it all from the wreckage.
Ugh, damn stupid pirates. I don't know why I ever liked them in the first place!
Well, your kind of pirates are from centuries ago. They don't make them like that anymore.
You have a point. All the good pirates either went down with their ship, or by the executioner's axe.
You know, before Klaus Störtebeker was executed, he made a deal to try and win some of his crew's freedom.
As many men as his headless body could walk past would go free. They say he stumbled past ten. That's honor. Sable would be too busy bargaining for his own worthless life.

Fields.MenuText: Now that kind of pirate, I could respect.
Headless bodies walking around? Sounds like a tall tale to me.
You won't get any argument from me. I'm no fan of Sable either.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? That's a real pirate. This Blacksands is just a no good brigand.
That's not the point. I'm just saying that Sable is no Störtebeker. I should've seen that before.
What kind of stupid name is Blacksands anyway? Clearly someone's trying too hard.
You're holding onto a lot of anger there, Scharnhorst.
He betrayed me, Kapitän. The worst part is that I didn't see it coming. I got distracted meeting an actual pirate who blindsided and robbed me.
No one blames you. You know that, right?
I blame me. Now, let me get back to work on this stupid broken pile of junk. We need to get to our next assignment already.
I don't want you holding onto too much hate, Scharnhorst. For yourself, or even for Sable. It doesn't do us any good.
I'll let my anger go when he's dead. It's how every pirate story eventually ends.
That sounds like a sad story to me. I only want you to be happy.
Thanks, Kapitän, but now I must get to work.
I'm here to help. Tell me what to do.
You're willingly taking orders from me now? This might be a little fun.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, what's going on? Tell me you didn't have anything to do with this.
In that case, I'll keep my lips sealed.
Our brig is empty and there's a lifeboat missing. What did you do?
I...went down to talk to Sable. You told me you didn't want me to hold onto my anger, so I thought I'd get it all out before we turned him over.
Please don't tell me that somehow led to you facilitating a prisoner escape.
Okay, I won't tell you that.
Scharnhorst!
All I'll say is that we got to talking, there were apologies, and... Well, I never liked how all those pirate stories ended anyhow.
So you just forgave him like that? It was that easy?
No, but I understand him a little better now. I don't like him, but I don't hate him. I didn't think he deserved to die.

Fields.MenuText: This is one huge mess...
We have to turn them in.
If I weren't a captain, I'm not sure I would have made a different call.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know, but it's not really as bad as you might think.
Do we really? Hear me out first, Kapitän.
Really? Thanks, Kapitän. I'm glad you understand.
We didn't tell anyone about the pirates, so there's no one expecting us to bring them in. The only people who know we even encountered them is the crew, and I trust them.
You know you're smiling right now? This is probably the riskiest plan you've ever come up with, and you're smiling.
Oh, come on, I've come up with plans way worse than this one.
I'm glad to see you're happy again. I don't like it when you're simmering in anger.
Then you better keep me happy.
@BATTLE
Ugh, stupid piece of broken technology!
Well, it doesn't look as bad. If I didn't know any better I might think it was actually functional.
Yeah, but it isn't. This is as far as we've got. We're out of options now, Kapitän. There's no fixing this pile of trash.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like giving up talk.
You might be right, it does look more like garbage than tech at this point.
But it was so expensive!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not giving up, I'm facing reality.
Exactly. I mean, look at this thing. It's covered in barnacles. Is this even part of the radar?
I know! It's killing me. Literally, I'm dying just thinking about this waste of money.
Hmmm, how about this? You like gambling, right?
Have you met me? Oh, do you want to play a game now? I can go grab my dice, or my cards.
No, I'm thinking of a different kind of gamble, with worse odds.
I'm listening.
This is thing is looking like it's impossible to fix, right? So the odds of it getting fixed are like, one in a million or something?
Not really, but I'm following you.
I bet you can't fix the radar, and I'm willing to bet...a year's salary on it.
A year? You'd go without getting paid for a year?
Like you said, it's impossible. Sounds like a safe bet to me.
You're on. I'm getting this thing fixed one way or another.
Wait, what do you get if I don't actually manage to fix it?
Oh, don't worry. I have something in mind.
Hmmm, as curious as I am to know what that is, you shouldn't count on getting it, because I'm winning this bet.
We'll see.
@BATTLE
Look at that, it's beeping and everything.
It's actually working? How'd you manage that?
Well, I had a lot of help. I might be sharing your salary with a good number of the crew.

Fields.MenuText: Well, we did make a bet.
Wait, I was joking about that.
I helped. Do I get a portion too?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes we did. You better not squelch on it, or I'll never forgive you.
Oh, really? It didn't sound like a joke. I already did my part, you better not back out of yours now.
Hmmm...maybe a small portion. Just enough to keep you from looking homeless.
You know, I'm not quite sure it's actually fixed though. We're gonna have to go test it out.
Well, you better go and report that we're done with Japan now.
I did. We're already heading to our next destination.
What? When did you do that?
As soon as I made the bet with you. I knew you'd never let me win.
What if I actually hadn't been able to fix it?
That...never occured to me.
You got a lot of faith in me, huh?
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that, it's going off!
Well, at least we know it works for normal Morganas.
It's gonna work on them all, you'll see.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol dead ahead!
@BATTLE
So Kapitän, if you had won the bet, what would you have wanted from me?
Oh, that? I would've made you fix the radar.
What? How does that make any sense?
Well, I know you pay your debts, so I figured that either way, you'd have to fix the radar. It was a foolproof plan. Just one way was more expensive for me.
That's...cunning of you.

Fields.MenuText: A compliment from you? Keep 'em coming.
Eh, even I can get lucky once in a while.
You say that like I'm an idiot.

Fields.DialogueText: All you have to do is keep earning them then, Kap.
Don't be too down on yourself. I think you get lucky quite often.
You're definitely not an idiot. Dense maybe, but not an idiot.
You know, I was worried that you had something else in mind for me if I lost the bet.
Like?
A...date...
Heh, I wouldn't want you to have to date me because you lost a bet.
Now that, that is honorable.
Hey, Scharnhorst, why don't we gamble one more time. The odds are a little long, but—
That's never stopped me before. What are we playing? Should I get my dice or my cards?
That's not what I meant. I was thinking... I have feelings for you, Scharnhorst. I'd like to take a gamble on us, and see where we could end up?
You and me? That's about the furthest thing from gambling that I can think of, Kapitän.
